results.title: The Goddess and the moon man
results.creator_credit: Morning Star Productions, Sandra Holmes and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: A myth about Pukamani, a mortuary ceremony of the Tiwi people of Melville Island, Northern Australia. Dramatically told through the use of the authentic Pukamani grave posts, sculptures and artefacts, fashioned long ago by Tiwi elders for the ceremony.

results.title: The Goalkeeper - with Ray Clemence
results.creator_credit: Opix Films, Ray Marshall and Terry Ryan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
England’s keeper Ray Clemence demonstrates the technique involved in safe goalkeeping including handling, clearances, and organising defences of set pieces. Also provides insight into the responsibilities of a goalkeeper in the modern game.

results.title: The Goalkeeper's fear of the penalty = Die Angst des Tormanns beim Elfmeter
results.creator_credit: Filmverlag der Autoren, Osterreichische Telefilm AG, Peter Genee and Wim Wenders
results.brief_description: A professional goalkeeper, for no apparent reason, allows the opposing team to score an easy goal. A few days later he committs an equally motiveless murder. The film follows the goalkeeper’s retreat to a small village on the Austrian border where he spends his time following television accounts of the police search for the murderer. Wim Wenders’ early film is a claustrophobic study of a man alienated from a sterile society to the point where he can only express his loneliness and fear through acts of random irrationality. An early film of the German New Wave of the seventies, “The Goalkeeper’s Fear of the Penalty” uses the thriller genre to explore contemporary questions of social disintegration.
results.title_for_label: The Goalkeeper’s fear of the penalty = Die Angst des Tormanns beim Elfmeter

results.title: The Go-between
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone, World Film Services, Robert Velaise, John Heyman, Norman Priggen and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: Based on L.P. Hartley’s classic Edwardian novel. The screenplay written by Harold Pinter is the story of lost love, youth and innocence. Spending a long hot summer at a Norfolk stately home, a young boy becomes the misunderstood carrier of love letters between an aristocratic lady and a local farmer - a forbidden romance ending in heartbreak and tragedy for all. Cast includes Julie Christie, Dominic Guard, Margaret Leighton, Michael Redgrave, Michael Gough, Edward Fox and Alan Bates.

results.title: The Glow worm
results.brief_description: A film made to show the characteristics and habits of glow-worms; shows male and female glow-worms for identification and comparisons; laying of eggs by the female; hatching of the young in the spring; details of thorax, head and other parts of glow-worm; the hunt for food; changes of skin; further changes of skin in Summer when adult males and females emerge; changed structure of the glow-worm; mating and continuance of the life cycle.

results.title: The Global warming. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Vision Group, London Weekend Television, Mark Redhead and Jean-Marc Seban
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Climate & man”.
Global Warming and the Greenhouse Effect are no longer unknown scientific concepts. They affect all people on the globe, and the prevention of further deterioration of the environment and atmosphere are critical issues facing governments. This comprehensive examination of the the causes and implications of greenhouse and global warming also looks at possible strategies which will in time slow down the devastation caused by these phenomena.

results.title: The Global struggle for food
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
A progress report on efforts to stave off the threatening crisis in world food supply, to find new ways of feeding the earth’s swelling population. Water control, land redistribution, agricultural advances of all kinds are shown as examples of gains being made to stem the tides of hunger.

results.title: The Global environment
results.brief_description: From acid rain to the greenhouse effect, from rainforests to desertification… this highly acclaimed series brings together the major world environmental issues and presents them in a form that is both accessible and easy to use. The ten, 20 minute programmes examine themes such as - the limited nature of our global resources, the interdependence of human life and the physical environment, the necessity of a sustainable basis for development. Underlying this is a central message - that an understanding of these themes is crucial if our planet is to survive. The video comes with notes for teachers offering an outline of each programme and useful resources for follow-up work. The ten parts are: 1 - ‘In the shadow of the city’: urbanisation. 2 - ‘Breaking Ground’: Soil erosion and desertification. 3 - ‘What’s on tap’: water pollution. 4 - ‘Timber!’: forest management. 5 - ‘The Greenhouse Effect’: global warming and possible effects. 6 - ‘Power for the people’: energy conservation. 7 - ‘A Breath of fresh air’: air pollution and acid rain. 8 - ‘Down in the dumps’: waste and waste recycling. 9 - ‘The Troubled sea’: overfishing and ocean pollution. 10 - ‘Our future world’: round-up of the series. Suitable for years 7-10.

results.title: The Global Economy
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
results.brief_description: An Open Learning University video course in Economics. This series examines some of the questions concerning contemporary students of Economics and International Relations. Each episode incorporates a round-table panel discussion by international economists who discuss the issues and themes introduced.
